p: It is well-known that inflammatory cells control the cancer microenvironment, while inflammation plays a crucial role in cancer progression [ 74, 75]. It is also reported in a mechanistic review that the mechanisms for anticancer activity of honey are antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, apoptotic, immunomodulatory, TNF inhibiting, antiproliferative and provide estrogenic effects [ 76]. However, this study was not specific to SBH, and although there are some studies that have reported the anticancer activity of SBH, though the mechanisms of its activity are still not completely clear.
